detaileddescription.para: value that stands for an infinite degree of an expression (see SCIPexprGetMaxDegree)

memberdef.name: SCIP_DECL_EXPREVAL
memberdef.initializer: SCIP_RETCODE x (SCIP_EXPROPDATA opdata, int nargs, SCIP_Real* argvals, SCIP_Real* varvals, SCIP_Real* paramvals, SCIP_Real* result)

detaileddescription.para: signature of an expression (pointwise) evaluation function The function should return nan, inf, or -inf in result if the function is undefined for the given arguments.

listitem.para: result buffer where to store result of evaluation

memberdef.name: SCIP_DECL_EXPRINTEVAL
memberdef.initializer: SCIP_RETCODE x (SCIP_Real infinity, SCIP_EXPROPDATA opdata, int nargs, SCIP_INTERVAL* argvals, SCIP_INTERVAL* varvals, SCIP_Real* paramvals, SCIP_INTERVAL* result)

detaileddescription.para: signature of an expression (interval) evaluation function The function should return an empty interval if the function is undefined for the given arguments.

listitem.para: result buffer where to store result of evaluation

memberdef.name: SCIP_DECL_EXPRCURV
memberdef.initializer: SCIP_RETCODE x (SCIP_Real infinity, SCIP_EXPROPDATA opdata, int nargs, SCIP_INTERVAL* argbounds, SCIP_EXPRCURV* argcurv, SCIP_EXPRCURV* result)

detaileddescription.para: signature of a simple expression curvature check function

listitem.para: argbounds bounds on value of arguments
result buffer where to store result of curvature check

memberdef.name: SCIP_DECL_EXPRCOPYDATA
memberdef.initializer: SCIP_RETCODE x (BMS_BLKMEM* blkmem, int nchildren, SCIP_EXPROPDATA opdatasource, SCIP_EXPROPDATA* opdatatarget)

detaileddescription.para: signature of a expression data copy function

listitem.para: nchildren number of children in expression
opdatatarget pointer to target expression data

memberdef.name: SCIP_DECL_EXPRFREEDATA
memberdef.initializer: void x (BMS_BLKMEM* blkmem, int nchildren, SCIP_EXPROPDATA opdata)

detaileddescription.para: signature of a expression data free function

listitem.para: nchildren number of children in expression

memberdef.name: SCIP_DECL_EXPRGRAPHVARADDED
memberdef.initializer: SCIP_RETCODE x (SCIP_EXPRGRAPH* exprgraph, void* userdata, void* var, SCIP_EXPRGRAPHNODE* varnode)

detaileddescription.para: callback method of expression graph invoked when a new variable has been added to the graph

input:
exprgraph expression graph
userdata a pointer to user data
var variable that has been added to expression graph
varnode new expression graph node for a variable

memberdef.name: SCIP_DECL_EXPRGRAPHVARREMOVE
memberdef.initializer: SCIP_RETCODE x (SCIP_EXPRGRAPH* exprgraph, void* userdata, void* var, SCIP_EXPRGRAPHNODE* varnode)

detaileddescription.para: callback method of expression graph invoked when a variable is to be removed from the graph

input:
exprgraph expression graph
userdata a pointer to user data
var variable that will be removed from the expression graph
varnode expression graph node corresponding to variable

memberdef.name: SCIP_DECL_EXPRGRAPHVARCHGIDX
memberdef.initializer: SCIP_RETCODE x (SCIP_EXPRGRAPH* exprgraph, void* userdata, void* var, SCIP_EXPRGRAPHNODE* varnode, int oldidx, int newidx)

detaileddescription.para: callback method of expression graph invoked when a variable changes its index

input:
exprgraph expression graph
userdata a pointer to user data
var variable which will change its index
varnode expression graph node corresponding to variable
oldidx current index of variable
newidx new index the variable will have
bounds are valid, i.e., conform with bounds of children
a child bounds were tightened since last calculation
bounds are not valid and need to be recomputed, because the bounds in a child were relaxed
bounds have been tightened by reverse propagation in a parent, they are valid as long as there has been no relaxation of bounds somewhere in the graph

memberdef.name: SCIP_EXPRBOUNDSTATUS_TIGHTENEDBYPARENTRECENT
memberdef.initializer: (0x8 | SCIP_EXPRBOUNDSTATUS_TIGHTENEDBYPARENT)

detaileddescription.para: bounds have recently been tightened by reverse propagation in a parent, this tightening has not been propagated further down yet

memberdef.name: SCIP_EXPRBOUNDSTATUS_TIGHTENEDBYPARENTFORCE
memberdef.initializer: (0x10 | SCIP_EXPRBOUNDSTATUS_TIGHTENEDBYPARENTRECENT)

detaileddescription.para: bounds may have recently been tightened by reverse propagation in a parent, in any case we want to propagate bounds further down

memberdef.name: SCIP_DECL_USEREXPRESTIMATE
memberdef.initializer: SCIP_RETCODE x (SCIP_Real infinity, SCIP_USEREXPRDATA* data, int nargs, SCIP_Real* argvals, SCIP_INTERVAL* argbounds, SCIP_Bool overestimate, SCIP_Real* coeffs, SCIP_Real* constant, SCIP_Bool *success)

detaileddescription.para: signature of an user's expression under/over estimation function The function should return nan, inf, or -inf in result if the function is undefined for the given arguments.

listitem.para: argbounds bounds on value of arguments
overestimate flag indicating whether to over- or under estimate the expression
coeffs buffer where to store resulting coeffs of arguments for the estimator
constant buffer where to store resulting constant of the estimator
success buffer to indicate whether under-/overestimation was successful

memberdef.name: SCIP_DECL_USEREXPREVAL
memberdef.initializer: SCIP_RETCODE x (SCIP_USEREXPRDATA* data, int nargs, SCIP_Real* argvals, SCIP_Real* funcvalue, SCIP_Real* gradient, SCIP_Real* hessian)

detaileddescription.para: signature of an user's expression (pointwise) evaluation function The function should return nan, inf, or -inf in result if the function is undefined for the given arguments.

listitem.para: funcvalue buffer where to store result of function evaluation
gradient buffer where to store result of gradient evaluation (NULL if not requested)
hessian buffer where to store result of Hessian evaluation (NULL if not requested, currently full dense matrix)

memberdef.name: SCIP_DECL_USEREXPRINTEVAL
memberdef.initializer: SCIP_RETCODE x (SCIP_Real infinity, SCIP_USEREXPRDATA* data, int nargs, SCIP_INTERVAL* argvals, SCIP_INTERVAL* funcvalue, SCIP_INTERVAL* gradient, SCIP_INTERVAL* hessian)

detaileddescription.para: signature of an user's expression (interval) evaluation function The function should return an empty interval if the function is undefined for the given arguments.

listitem.para: funvalue buffer where to store result of function evaluation
gradient buffer where to store result of gradient evaluation (NULL if not requested)
hessian buffer where to store result of Hessian evaluation (NULL if not requested, currently full dense matrix)

memberdef.name: SCIP_DECL_USEREXPRCURV
memberdef.initializer: SCIP_RETCODE x (SCIP_Real infinity, SCIP_USEREXPRDATA* data, int nargs, SCIP_INTERVAL* argbounds, SCIP_EXPRCURV* argcurv, SCIP_EXPRCURV* result)

detaileddescription.para: signature of a user's expression curvature check function

listitem.para: argbounds bounds on value of arguments
result buffer where to store result of curvature check

memberdef.name: SCIP_DECL_USEREXPRPROP
memberdef.initializer: SCIP_RETCODE x (SCIP_Real infinity, SCIP_USEREXPRDATA* data, int nargs, SCIP_INTERVAL* argbounds, SCIP_INTERVAL funcbounds, SCIP_Bool* cutoff)

detaileddescription.para: signature of an user's expression interval propagation function The function should compute intervals of the arguments given an interval for the function itself and all arguments.

listitem.para: argbounds bounds on values of arguments (on output: tightened bounds)
cutoff buffer to indicate whether an empty child interval was found

memberdef.name: SCIP_DECL_USEREXPRCOPYDATA
memberdef.initializer: SCIP_RETCODE x (BMS_BLKMEM* blkmem, int nchildren, SCIP_USEREXPRDATA* datasource, SCIP_USEREXPRDATA** datatarget)

detaileddescription.para: signature of a user's expression data copy function

listitem.para: nchildren number of children in expression

memberdef.name: SCIP_DECL_USEREXPRFREEDATA
memberdef.initializer: void x (BMS_BLKMEM* blkmem, int nchildren, SCIP_USEREXPRDATA* data)

detaileddescription.para: signature of a user's expression data free function

listitem.para: nchildren number of children in expression
data user expression data to free

detaileddescription.para: variable given by index (stored in data.idx)
constant (value stored in data.dbl)
parameter = a constant that can be modified (should not be simplified away)
addition (2 operands)
substraction (2 operands)
multiplication (2 operands)
division (2 operands)
square (1 operand)
square root (1 operand)
power with real exponent (1 operand!, assumed to be nonnegative, exponent is stored in expression data)
power with integer exponent (1 operand!, exponent stored in expression data)
signed power (sign(x)|x|^a, 1 operand!, exponent is stored in expression data)
exponential (e^x, 1 operand)
natural logarithm (ln(x), 1 operand)
sinus (1 operand)
cosinus (1 operand)
tangent (1 operand)
gaussian error function (1 operand) imaginary part of gaussian error function (1 operand) minimum (2 operands)
maximum (2 operands)
absolute value (1 operand)
sign of value (1 operand)
summation sum_{i=1}^n op_i (n operands)
product prod_{i=1}^n op_i (n operands)
linear term sum_{i=1}^n a_i op_i (n operands)
quadratic term sum_{i,j=1}^n a_{i,j} op_i op_j (n operands)
polynomial term sum_{I} a_{I}ops^I (I a multiindex, n operands)
a user defined expression
no expression, used for counting reasons
Operators of expressions.
unknown curvature (or indefinite)
convex
concave
linear = convex and concave
Curvature types
expression operand
expression operand data
expression
expression tree
curvature types
element of a quadratic term
the data of a quadratic expression (SCIP_EXPR_QUADRATIC)
a monomial as part of the data in a polynomial expression
the data of a polynomial expression (SCIP_EXPR_POLYNOMIAL)
expression data of a user expression (not the user-data of a user expression)
node in an expression graph
an expression graph (DAG)
bitflags that indicate the status of bounds stored in a node of an expression graph
the user data of a user expression

briefdescription.para: type definitions for expressions and expression trees
